New Records: Sese Bau became the second Papua New Guinea batter to hit a fifty in the T20 World Cup.
Key Match Events: Sese Bau played a fine knock of 50 runs against co-hosts West Indies.
WI captain Rovman Powell won the toss and chose to bowl vs Papua New Guinea.
Romario Shepherd claimed the wicket of Tony Ura in the second over.
Spinner Akeal Hosein dismissed Lega Siaka with a well-executed arm ball.
Alzarri Joseph sent PNG skipper Assad Vala back to the pavilion.
Sese Bau's 44-run partnership with Charles Amini helped stabilize PNG's innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: PNG faced an uphill battle from the outset, starting their innings on a shaky note.
West Indies' bowlers, particularly their spinners, exploited the pitch conditions effectively.
